newsitem.title: USA: Grain stocks correction due to math error - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Grain stocks correction due to math error - USDA.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Department was forced to correct its soybean stocks report because of a computational error, the chairman of Agricultural Statistics Board said Tuesday.
The correct figure for U.S. stocks as of March 1 was 1,055,607,000 bushels, USDA said.
Chairman Rich Allen said errors were made computing the off-farm stocks figure for Mississippi that ignored decimal places and inflated the state total and, in turn, U.S. total.
A standard review failed to uncover the flaw.
Allen said it has been about three decades since a stocks report had to be corrected.
USDA corrected the off-farm soybean stocks total for Mississippi to 8,675,000 bushels and the state total to 10,875,000 bushels.
The U.S. total was corrected to 1,055,607,000 bushels and off-farm total was corrected to 541,607,000 bushels. On-farm stocks remained at 514,000,000 bushels.
